Let G be a permutation group on the finite set Ω. A partition ρ of Ω is said to be G-regular if there exists a subset S of Ω such that Sg is a transversal of ρ for all g ∈ G. The group G is said to be synchronizing if |Ω| > 2 and there are no non-trivial proper G-regular partitions on Ω.

a) Are the following affine-type primitive groups synchronizing:
2p.PSL(2, 2p + 1) where both p and 2p + 1 are prime, p ≡ 3 (mod 4) and p > 23?
2101.He?

b) For which finite simple groups S are the groups S × S acting on S by (g, h) : x 7→ g−1xh non-synchronizing?

P. M. Neumann
